alert.note: Alert for York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:29AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...THUNDERSTORMS WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT WESTERN CABARRUS...SOUTHEASTERN IREDELL...MECKLENBURG...WESTERN ROWAN... WESTERN UNION AND SOUTHEASTERN YORK COUNTIES UNTIL 615 AM EDT... At 528 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with torrential rainfall along a line extending from 5 miles southeast of Statesville to 6 miles southeast of Rock Hill, and moving northeast at 20 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Uptown Charlotte, Huntersville, Kannapolis, Downtown Concord, Salisbury, Statesville, Monroe, Rock Hill, Central Charlotte and South Charlotte. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: The combination of gusty winds and heavy rain may cause scattered trees and power lines to fall. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
